tourName: French Polynesia luxury villa & catamaran cruise holiday
placesVisited: Tahiti, Rurutu, Tetiaroa, Luxury five-day catamaran cruise in the Society Islands, Relax in elegance and comfort in an island paradise, Stay in locally owned lodges with strong environmental credentials
generalInfo:
Bury your toes in a black sand beach, or dangle them in the sea on a private catamaran cruise, on this French Polynesia luxury villa holiday that gives you a far deeper immersion into island life than any stay in an all-inclusive resort ever could.

Whether you’re on honeymoon, or just seeking an escape from a hectic life back home, it won’t take long to slip into the rhythm of French Polynesia thanks to this carefully designed holiday. One day might see you snorkelling above a colourful coral reef with manta rays and turtles for company, another might find you on a gentle stroll through villages to meet local artisans, the next enjoying a soak and a massage at a traditional Polynesian spa.

With time on both Tahiti and Rurutu, you’ll stay in beautifully designed, luxurious villas that have a strong environmental focus. Using locally sourced and also recycled materials wherever possible, they are built to have a minimal carbon footprint, and use solar power.

And, at the heart of your trip, a private five-day catamaran cruise through the Society Islands. Swim, kayak, paddleboard or just relax on deck with a cocktail in hand, a dedicated local crew showing you around this idyllic archipelago and filling you in on the islands’ history and marine life. There can be few finer ways to experience French Polynesia.

dayInfo.description: Tahiti: A Quiet Pause Before the Sea Return to the main island for a peaceful overnight stay before setting sail. This brief interlude offers a chance to rest, reflect, and prepare for the next part of your journey — one that unfolds on the water, beneath sails and stars.

Tahiti: One Last Glimpse of Paradise Return once more to Tahiti for your final night in the islands. Let the memories rise gently — of ocean breezes, hidden coves, and starlit dinners. Your journey may be ending, but the spirit of Polynesia stays with you — a quiet, enduring presence that lives on in your heart.
